thread.title: CBS cancels Steven Spielberg-produced sci-fi series Extant, but is working with Halle Berry on new project - US TV
thread.title_full: CBS cancels Steven Spielberg-produced sci-fi series Extant, but is working with Halle Berry on new project - US TV News - Digital Spy

author: Justin Harp
title: CBS cancels Steven Spielberg-produced sci-fi series Extant, but is working with Halle Berry on new project - US TV
text: CBS is not moving ahead with a third season of Extant, but will work with its star Halle Berry on a new legal drama.The network announced that season two's "exciting and fitting conclusion" seemed like a natural place to end the Steven Spielberg-produced sci-fi series. © CBS / Amazon Prime Instant Video "I am so proud of what we accomplished on Extant," Berry said in a press release. "This season seemed such a natural place to end Molly's journey that I, along with CBS, felt it best served the story to leave it there. "I've loved this experience working with such a talented cast and creative team. ‎It was my first foray into episodic television, and I'm excited to continue my relationship with CBS, producing more compelling stories through my 606 Films production banner."Berry remains in business with CBS developing Legalese, a one-hour drama about a biracial Chicago lawyer partnering with a good ol' boy attorney on a New Orleans case.Extant premiered on CBS in the summer of 2013 with a story of an astronaut (Berry) returning to earth pregnant after a 13-month solo space mission.While CBS did order a second season of Extant to air this past summer, it retooled the cast by adding Jeffrey Dean Morgan and David Morrissey in major roles.Extant's cancellation comes just one month after CBS axed fellow summer drama Under the Dome.
